title: Ticket #4373: Upload HTCondor Week 2014 tutorials (and some talks) to web site
description:
The tutorials and some talks for HTCondor Week 2014 should be posted online. Ideally they would be available for download and for streaming. Don't post anything by someone not on HTCondor staff without getting clear permission from them. At the moment there are no non-HTCondor staff talks we plan on posting.

Work: Some of these steps may be merged together

  1. Check with speakers to ensure they think it's a good idea to post them. There is a strong bias in favor of posting them! This has been done for User, DAGMan and Admin tutorials, which are the most important three.
  2. Decide between the mp4 files and wmv files as a source. Consider quality, legibility of the slides, and space wasted on letterboxing/pillarboxing. Might want to use mp4 for the speaker and wmv for the slides.
  3. Split files that contain multiple tutorials into individual files.
  4. Trim "dead time" (time when we have recordings before or after the tutorial). In some cases we've just got video of a basically empty room. In others, we've got video of the word "RECORDING." In the case of the User and DAGMan tutorials, there is people loitering and and getting set up.
  5. Cropping to remove pillar-boxing/letter-boxing/etc
  6. Cropping to remove useless space around the speaker. Most important for the User and DAGMan tutorials, as there there are audience members nearby, and their motion is distracting. The User tutorial's speaker is confirmed to stay to a fairly small area; other speakers may wander around, either requiring a bigger crop space, or tracking them through the video.
  7. Add a nice title page; it might be as simple as the first slide of the talk. You can get HTCondor logos at http://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/logos/htcondor_logos/
  8. If the video of the slides is poor, consider taking stills from the original slides (http://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/HTCondorWeek2014/monday.html ) and manually adding them. The User and DAGMan tutorials would really like this, as the video quality if very poor. This won't work if there are animations (Admin tutorial), although it could work if you're willing to make a screencast and burn a lot of time.
  9. Arrange resulting video in a reasonably common size; failing that a common aspect ratio; failing that just don't make it too crazy.
  10. Transcode into H.264(baseline)+AAC(low complexity)+MP4 and WebM. If necessary, offer both in a low-resolution version. (See HostingVideo)
  11. Set up for download (See HostingVideo)
  12. Set up for streaming. (See HostingVideo)
  13. Ensure links to slides are adjacent to the videos.
  14. Archive the final video files to DVD and get them to Alan.

Alan has the raw videos on puffin.cs.wisc.edu:/scratch/adesmet/htcondor-week-2014-videos/ and on DVD (check the "MISC" box in Alan's office). The file names are the date and timestamp of when that "block" of video was supposed to start; you can determine which talks are in which files by comparing it to http://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/HTCondorWeek2014/monday.html

Videos we probably want to post:

  • The essentials:

    • DONE An Introduction to Using HTCondor, Karen Miller - Was rerecorded later as HTCondor Week 2014 version wasn't recorded. - Confirmed okay to post. - Early work suggests it should probably start at 0:11:52 and probably runs for 0:69:15 (so ending at 1:20:07)

    • DONE Introduction to Workflows with DAGMan, Ken Wenger - Was rerecorded later as HTCondor Week 2014 version wasn't recorded. - Confirmed okay to post.

    • DONE Advanced Workflows with DAGMan, Kent Wenger - Confirmed okay to post - ./Disc 6/2014-04-30-14-55.*

    • DONE Administrating HTCondor, Alan De Smet - Confirmed okay to post. - Disc 1/2014-04-28-10-50-admin.*

  • Would be nice:

    • DONE Python and HTCondor, Tim Theisen - Disc 5/2014-04-30-13-40-resources.* roughly 0:16:20, interrupted and continues in /Disc 5/2014-04-30-13-55-python.* roughly 0:15:57. Don't know how much we lost; need to assess. If it's non-trivial, consider it a lost cause. - Confirmed permission

    • DONE Monitoring HTCondor with Ganglia, Tim Theisen - Disc 5/2014-04-30-13-10-ganglia.* roughly 0:06:00 - Confirmed permission

    • DONE Communicating with Users about HTCondor and High Throughput Computing, Lauren Michael - Disc 4/2014-04-30-09-00.mp4 and Disc 5/2014-04-30-09-00.wmv starting about 0:59:55 - Confirmed permission

    • DONE Managing GPUs as a custom resource with condor_gpu_discovery, John (TJ) Knoeller - Disc 5/2014-04-30-13-10-ganglia.* roughly 0:34:00, is truncated and continues in Disc 5/2014-04-30-13-40-resources.* at start - This video starts a minute or two late; we don't have the missing video. Assess, if non-trivial amount is missing, consider it a lost cause. - Confirmed permission

    • DONE Securing a Basic HTCondor Pool, Zach Miller - ./Disc 6/2014-04-30-14-55.* starting roughly 0:51:00 - Confirmed permission

  • Bonus:

    • How High Throughput was My Cluster?, Greg Thain - Disc 1/2014-04-28-13-00.* starting roughly 1:37:06

    • HTCondor networking: present and future, Alan De Smet

    • Improvements to Configuration, John (TJ) Knoeller - Confirmed permission

    • Releasing HTCondor: Upstream, downstream, and more, Tim Theisen - Confirmed permission

See the attached images (bottom of ticket) for some possibilities for layout. These are based on the user tutorial.
